poem:
Title: A Pax Americanus Thus Spake

The hawk, upon high cliffs of power,
Does not hold back its aeon gaze.
Israel, quaking in the hour,
Feels the chill of sanction's haze.

Politic's cruel pendulum swings,
Whilst Cohen, in his gilded cage,
Hears the clanging judgment rings,
Feed the beast of media's rage.

Peace, in the hearts of soldiers bled,
Upon this harsh and vengeful stage.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US says hold on weapons delivery won’t be a one-off if Israel presses ahead with Rafah offensive – live 8.56pm BST Summary Here is a wrap-up of the day’s key events: The Republican House judiciary committee has referred Michael Cohen to the Department of Justice for prosecution. In a letter to Merrick Garland, the US attorney general, Jim Jordan and James Comer, chairs of the judiciary committee as well as the oversight and accountability committee,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
